Authors: Chao Ge Wang, Yu Cheng Dai
Title:
Phylogeny of Spongipellis and its morphological similar
genus, plus two genera in Cerrenaceae
Keywords:
Cerrenaceae, phylogeny, Sarcodontia, taxonomy,
wood-decaying fungi
Abstract:
Phylogenetic and morphological analyses on Spongipellis
and related genera, Irpiciporus, Loweomyces and Radulodon are carried
out. Phylogenies on species of the genus are reconstructed with multiple
loci DNA sequences including the internal transcribed spacer regions
(ITS), the large subunit (nLSU) and the small subunit (nSSU) of nuclear
ribosomal RNA gene and the translation elongation factor 1-Î± gene
(TEF1). The results demonstrate the polyphyly of Spongipellis, including
two different genera belong to different families, Pseudospongipellis is
as a new genus established including three new combinations. Three new
species Irpiciporus sinuosus, Radulodon yunnanensis and Spongipellis
quercicola spp. nov. are described and illustrated.
